description: Beneficiary, applicant, and amounts should be consistent across documents.
suggestion: Ensure beneficiary, applicant, and amounts are consistently stated across documents.

description: Shipment terms like Incoterms, port of loading/discharge should be clear.
suggestion: Include Incoterms (e.g., FOB/CIF), port of loading and port of discharge.

description: Goods description should not be materially different across documents; minor abbreviations acceptable.
suggestion: Align goods description across LC and documents; avoid material discrepancies.

description: Incoterms should include term, version (year), and a named place.
suggestion: Specify Incoterms term (e.g., CIF), version (e.g., Incoterms 2020), and named place (e.g., CIF Shanghai).

description: Beneficiary/applicant names and addresses should be consistent, ignoring trivial punctuation/case.
suggestion: Ensure consistent spelling and addresses for beneficiary and applicant.

description: Invoice issuer should be the beneficiary; handle currency/amount tolerances as per LC.
suggestion: State that the commercial invoice is issued by the beneficiary and respects any tolerances.

description: Counts of originals and copies for each document should align with LC requirements.
suggestion: Specify the number of originals and copies required for transport and other documents.
